title: A quick recap about the upcoming Zed comic – what we know and what the can expect
body:
So, maybe you already have seen the cover of the upcoming Zed comic in the 10th Anniversary stream.

https://imgur.com/a/AVXbzUc

With the comic on the horizon, I thought it would be a good idea to make a post about all the things we already know about the comic.

**The author** ~~of the journals~~

For the people who don’t know the author of the Zed comic is, it is Odin Schafer, better known as WAAARGHbobo. He also wrote Warmother and is one of the most active Riot narrative folk on the SA&S Boards.

> There are two other series, in early production. Hopefully the second series will launch roughly when Ashe: Warmother ends. John O'brian is writing the second series. I wrote the third. We won't be back in the Freljord till after then... but hopefully if this series does well we will be able to return after that.

[Source](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/luKNAK3m-ashe-warmother-issue-1-avail-nows?comment=000c0000)

Anyway, let’s begin to analysis the cover and what it means.

**The characters of the comic**

So the look on the cover shows us Zed (surprise), Jhin’s mask, which we can assume is the assassin Zed is after, Akali, Shen, a new person which name is Jovn Tau and probably Kayn which can’t really see here since the cover is cut off. The cover also fits with the information we got from Odin as well.

> […]
> The Zed comic is, not surprisingly, hyper-focused on Zed. But I will say Zed, Kayn, Akali, Shen, Jovn Tau, and Jhin are all on the cover...
> […]

[Source](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/XV5NT7wn-could-shen-and-zed-actually-catch-jhin?comment=0002)

Okay let’s talk about the elephant in the room – Zed’s face reveal. While I’m not against it per se, revealing it on the cover feels incredible anticlimax for me. Not considering I’m really not happy with his face itself, especially his white hair. It looks like something I would expect from a fan artist and not from an official Riot work because the design itself feels to uninspired to be Zed for me.
Also, he is missing [his shadow magic tattoos](https://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_GB/story/champion/zed/) which is a shame because already saw his tattoos in the shown concept arts from the[ /Dev video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zqRxNzp9yCI) earlier this year.

https://imgur.com/a/7MG3fuA

**The length of the comic**

The “1 of 6” means we get 6 issues instead of 5 like the Lux comic. Odin mentioned this a while ago while writing the script. One more issue means one issue more content and I doubt anyone will complain about it.

> […]
> Zed is spinning up production soon... and I'm not allowed to say much about him. I can say he has 6 scripts done, and first script is locked (I.e. ready for the artist).
> […]

[Source](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/qabiFIYq-how-it-can-be-that-we-still-have-no-further-information-regarding-the-upcoming-comics?comment=00040003)

**The (main focus of the) story**

I just add a few comments which made Odin about the comic.

> […]
> 1) yeah obviously. Lux is next. Then maybe the Zed thing I wrote. (I'm not sure if that is going forward at this point) I can't speak for the Lux comic, but the Zed lets the reader take a deep dive into who he is-- but also what Ionia is like.
> […]

[Source](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/oT3p6ZRy-ashe-warmother-issue-4-available-now-in-special-addition-or-free?comment=000400000000000000000000)

> It does contain flashback _scenes_ as typical comic readers and most league players don’t actually know who Zed is, why he fights, or even why he and Shen have beef. (The boards users’ knowledge level is much higher than the average joes—actually most league players knowledge of lore comes **only** from VO)
> Like the Lux comic, the Zed comic starts in the recent past, but will begin advancing the timeline around its midpoint. But even in this recent past, for the people that already know Zed, Shen, and Jhin’s lores there’s a lot of new stuff you will discover.

[Source](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/FO8MrxdX-which-story-would-you-like-to-move-forward-after-demacia?comment=00010001)

> […]
> The Zed comic is, not surprisingly, hyper-focused on Zed. But I will say Zed, Kayn, Akali, Shen, Jovn Tau, and Jhin are all on the cover...
> And it’s coming soon. 
> I will say there’s a couple of big misdirections in that old Jhin story. I’m not gonna say what —but that story is gonna go down... and not in the way you might think. 
> […]

[Source](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/XV5NT7wn-could-shen-and-zed-actually-catch-jhin?comment=0002)

**Release date**

The release date is in November since it got postponed because of the 10th Anniversary.

> “I think it was gonna be this month but with the massive amount of stuff for the ten year anniversary. It was pushed to Nov.” -said man

[Source](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/xtlxU7oA-when-is-the-zed-comic-coming-out?comment=0001)

Edit:
>I was told the 10th anniversary book would effect our publish date. Not the anniversary itself. (I clarified that in a post after the first.). I wasn’t clear enough on my first post. Brevity is sometimes the enemy of clarity. My bad.

[Odin's answer in this theard](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/765RkwlE-a-quick-recap-about-the-upcoming-zed-comic-what-we-know-and-what-the-can-expect?comment=0007)

Consider the former releases always have been on the second Wednesday of every month, we would expect the comic to drop on the 13th November.
**However**, since at this day both Realms of Runeterra and the physical edition of the Lux comic will come out and the comic is not available to preorder on Marvel Comics online nor Comixology yet, we can assume it will drop a month later on the **11th December**.

Anyway, that’s everything I think should be said to the upcoming comic. Are y’all as excited as I’m for the release?

replies.body:
Nice work Lady Faceless!

Two very minor corrections. (+1 one fun fact)

1)
Zed does have shadow tattoos.  You just haven’t seen them yet.   My big reveal: you will eventually get to see Zed’s (omitted)  And yes he is quite handsome but scarred. (Lol)

2) 
I was told the 10th anniversary *book* would effect our publish date.  Not the anniversary itself.   (I clarified that in a post after the first.). I wasn’t clear enough on my first post.  Brevity is sometimes the enemy of clarity.  My bad.

Fun Fact) 
We actually did a bunch of explorations for Zed’s (and Shen’s) face.  Trying to find out: how anime, how villainous, tragic and handsome Zed should be.  And actually weren’t  really aware of, or inspired by the fan art.  (And Kinda still not aware of it)

Going back 5 years now, i pitched a very different version of this story (pre Jhin).  And in that pitch, I had described Zed as “haunted, his youthful beauty, once overwhelming, has faded like a parchment too long in the sun.”

The white hair came out of trying to find a way to show Zed as both haunted and exceptional.  And more importantly, to place him in a clear iconic lineup (Black for Kayn, Red for Shen, White for Zed).  This is less a choice for the comic medium, but a strategic choice for other media going forward. (None is planned btw). 

 This sort of iconic character design choices ensure that if these characters are in some crazy animation fight scene we can clearly and quickly identify each character (in close-up or wide) with only a few frames (1/4 second).  

 Probably the fan artist had a similar goals (consciously or subconsciously).  So probably they deserve kudos for realizing what we struggled with. 

I will also say-  I instantly loved the designs for Big Boi Shen in this comic. I desperately want an unmasked version of him in our games.  And want to see him as beefy as he is in the comic (his physicality is based on Mongolian wrestlers).  He’s big.  He’s tough. He feels things, intensely, but is trying to hold back and do the right thing.

But I also struggled with Zed’s hair and looks initially. He wasn’t exactly what i had in my head, even though i had kinda described what he is now. (Minus the hair color).  Now, I honestly see that our artists (Edgar and concept) were right.  As the comic’s goes forward, Zed’s face and it’s stoic sadness begins to sink into your heart and that comments on, and contrasts with, the raw aggression of his helmet and armor. 

Anywhoo
Thanks for compiling this for yer fellow forum pals

-O

Awaken, like most art, is a promotional piece, so Jhin has to look the same way in that that he does in his splash art, otherwise its false advertising. Since they gave him red eyes and mechanical limbs in his art, now they have to do that in everything else despite the fact that its not actually canon to the lore.

Admit it, you'd be disappointed if you saw this red eyed, mechanical limb having badass in a cinematic, only to find that in game he has blue eyes and just normal limbs covered in armor.

TLDR, they fucked up Jhin's splash art and never fixed it so now they have to fuck him up in everything else for the sake of continuity even though its not canon.
Hey Odin could you share where you think Zed would be on the D&D alignment chart, I think Shen is obviously true neutral

> [{quoted}](name=Spideraxe,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=765RkwlE,comment-id=00070003,timestamp=2019-10-22T23:45:00.345+0000)
>
> Hey Odin could you share where you think Zed would be on the D&D alignment chart, I think Shen is obviously true neutral

Lawful Evil for sure. If he was just fighting off Noxus to defend his homeland I'd put him Lawful Neutral along with many Demacian and Noxian champs, but his slaughtering of Kinkou, Vastaya and anyone who disagree with the Shadow Order methods make him evil.

The not so dirty secret is I hate, hate DnD's alignment system, I find it too simplistic.   
(BTW, I also hate the AC system-- how hard a target is "to hit" and how hard it is "to damage" should be separate comparative stats imho).     

Regardless _I do love_ chatting about alignments (in part because the system is so broken, it makes it an interesting challenge.) 

Honestly I'm not sure about Zed's alignment.  

Certainly I don't think he's lawful. He went against his _holy_ order, and has few concerns about breaking traditions.  But he's also sorta living within his cultures norms and has a code of honor he subscribes too.  And there's stuff ya'll don't know yet.   I guess would argue Zed is maybe neutral evil, depending on how you define "evil."   

  In all honestly, I'm really hoping that each issue of the comic will make you question what you thought about Zed's morality a little bit, question who he really is, and why he killed Kusho.  (even compared  to the previous issue) .

I agree. I had to think for like 5 minutes about whether the system observes "Lawful" from his perspective or in a universal sense. Only settled on yes because he wants to make the Shadow Order the dominant order in the Ionia so I couldn't say chaotic. Neutral is probably a better fit, but still unsatisfying and doesn't say anything about him.

It's like my bird- boi {{champion:50}} says "They would tell you there are those that are good and those who are evil, but in truth these words mean nothing... The only true measure of a soul is the strength of their will."

Tides of Numenera had an excellent, more nuanced system for assigning character alignments that sold me on the game, shame it didn't do so well financially. Character alignment was keyed to five different "Tides" which were distinctly color coded. A characters alignment was decided by a assigning  a Primary and then a Secondary Tide

The Five Tides are:

Gold - Altruism, Charity, Sacrifice and Empathy
Indigo - Justice, Compromise, Equity, The Greater Good
Blue - Wisdom, Enlightenment, Mysticism, Curiosity
Red - Passion, Emotion, Action, Zeal
Silver - Power, Acclaim, Legacy

So you could be Gold/Silver Tide a good guy whose actions seem benevolent on the outside, but really their actions are motivated by their own selfish desire or because he's only charitable for pragmatic reasons rather than more genuine ones. The system allows for more flexibility because it isn't rigidly attached to binary world-views, but instead reflects intrinsic motivations and character traits.

Someone like {{champion:13}} would dominantly be Blue Tide first, being a mage who values knowledge and secondarily would be Indigo because he wants to protect the world from itself and is willing to make great individual sacrifices to do so. His opposite Tides would be Gold because he has trouble meshing well with others as individuals despite, but that doesn't mean he's a bad person. It just means that he has chosen the Greater Good over Empathizing with the individual.

Changing the secondary alignment changes the flavor of the primary. Indigo/Gold ({{champion:86}} ) vs Indigo/Red ({{champion:10}})

I think in this system Zed would be Silver/Red. He seeks and values power and he's passionate about it, displaying the opposite of the Kinkou philosophy.
